name: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione
Reason: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the functional groups and structural features: The basic unit we can compare to is benzene, which has a melting point of 5 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 1,3-diphenylpropane-1,3-dione will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The carbonyl group introduces a strong dipole moment, which can increase the melting point by approximately +30 degrees Celsius.
